title: Set Firefox as your mail-to default on Windows
summary: Learn how to set Firefox as your MAILTO default on Windows and configure it to handle mail links seamlessly.
html:
You can configure how Firefox handles email links such as user@example.com on a webpage by setting the email application or website used in Firefox. When Firefox is set as your default browser on Windows, you can also set Firefox as your default mail handler. This guide explains how to set Firefox as the application that opens automatically when you click mail links.

Table of Contents

  • 1 Set Firefox as the default handler for mail links on Windows 10
  • 2 Set Firefox as the default handler for mail links on Windows 11
  • 3 Related articles

Set Firefox as the default handler for mail links on Windows 10

  1. Open the Windows Start menu and select Settings.
  2. In the Settings page, click Apps.
  3. In the left menu, select Default apps.
  4. Click the icon under the heading Email to show your choices.
  5. Select Firefox in the Choose an app menu.

Set Firefox as the default handler for mail links on Windows 11

  1. Open the Windows Start menu and select Settings.
  2. From your system Settings menu, click Apps.
    .
  3. Select Default apps.
  4. Scroll down to the Set defaults for applications section and click the Firefox app.
  5. Go to the MAILTO section and click on it, to see the available apps.
  6. From the app list, select Firefox as your default app and click the button.

On Windows 11, you can also go to Settings > Apps > Default Apps and enter MAILTO in the search box to find the application already set as the default, for example, Thunderbird. When you click on the entry that comes up, you can set a new default.
